intro: Plectrophora, commonly known as the "false sandalwood," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Lauraceae. It consists of several species, primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often in moist, shaded environments. Plectrophora species are valued for their fragrant wood and have been used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants.
